content: <rdf:RDF xmlns:foaf="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/" xmlns:owl="http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#" xmlns:rdfs="http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:dcat="http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#" xmlns:dct="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">   <dcat:Dataset rdf:about="https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/severe-weather-data-inventory">     <owl:sameAs rdf:resource="urn:uuid:DOC-2396"></owl:sameAs>     <dct:description>The Severe Weather Data Inventory (SWDI) is an integrated database of severe weather records for the United States. The records in SWDI come from a variety of sources in the NCDC archive. SWDI provides the ability  to search through all of these data to find records covering a particular time period and geographic region, and to download the results of your search in a variety of formats. The formats currently supported are Shapefile (for GIS), KMZ (for Google Earth), CSV (comma-separated), and XML. </dct:description>         <dcat:keyword>{radar</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>nexrad</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>storm</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>spotters</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>warnings</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>lightning</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>nldn</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>hail</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>mesocyclone</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>mda</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>tornado</dcat:keyword>         <dcat:keyword>"strikes "}</dcat:keyword>     <foaf:homepage
